meanings.sent1: My friend is known as one of the exaggerators in our group.
meanings.sent2: The exaggerators at the party made the story sound unbelievable.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerators in the class always make everyone laugh with their tall tales.
meanings.sent4: She was like one of those exaggerators in fairy tales, making everything seem larger than life.
meanings.sent5: The exaggerators in the town were like characters from a cartoon, always adding extra flair to their stories.

meanings.definition: Those who tend to overstate or magnify the truth.
meanings.sent1: The exaggerators in the office always make simple tasks seem like a big deal.
meanings.sent2: We all know a few exaggerators who make every situation seem more dramatic than it is.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerators in the family gatherings make the stories more entertaining with their colorful descriptions.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like those of exaggerators in legends, turning a small event into a grand adventure.
meanings.sent5: The exaggerators in the group were like artists, painting vivid pictures with their words.
